review_title: Dedicated to public welfare without compromising on service
job_title: SAP Team Manager in Jerusalem, Jerusalem
pros:
All of IT projects and developments are implemented with most efficiency under a tight budget as the donations are meant d for programs and welfare projects.
Yet the IT projects implemented in SAP and in other applications are in par or more efficient then industry standards.
cons: IT budgets as compared to other public and private organizations are very less as they are primarily meant for welfare programs.

pros: Good benefits, flexible hours in the week to make own schedule
cons: Disconnect from other programs in org

pros: Work with social impact and networking

- Meaningful job 
- Work with some really dedicated people, especially, in the field 
- Good social benefits 
- Work from home up to 3 days per week
cons:
- Bullying. Not only is bullying behavior scot-free, but these employees are  thriving at JDС 
- Lack of collaboration between departments. Lots of politics and red tape 
- Not human-oriented HR-staff 
- Nepotism, toadyism, and protekzia
- Long hours vs modest pay (in some departments)
- Toxic, manipulative executive managers

pros: Changing the world in small steps
cons:
Low wages 
Inability to preserve imployees

pros: stable job in jerusalem for a working mom
cons: politics, poor company culture, no real growth opportunities (depending on department)

job_title: Special Needs Assistant in Tel Aviv-Yafo
pros: a chance to meet interesting people and do a good deed.
cons: low salary and a lot of work.

review_title: The Gold Standard for Jewish Nonprofit
pros: Excellent team, very professional environment, meaningful mission, very good benefits package
cons: Very little room for growth, not possible to earn pay increases.

pros: Work culture, meaningful work, great people
cons: none that I can think of

review_title: Great Mission and Smart Mission Driven Professionals
pros: My experience has been one in which i was invested in, supported in my career growth, pushed to perform at very high standards and have been inspired by the caliber of my colleagues from day one
cons: Over the years, we have gotten more bureaucratic but i find that that also means that there has been more oversight of finances and consistency in how people are treated.

review_title: Great place to work in - and a great opportunity
pros: Great position to influence large scale projects and help social entrepreneurs tap into a lot of resources
cons: bureaucratic and big, it’s sometimes hard to navigate the politics between the two big partner organizations.
